info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 4:57PM EDT until June 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following county, Leon.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Florida A and M, Florida State University, Tallahassee State College, Doak Campbell Stadium, Governors Square Mall, Tallahassee Memorial Hosp, Indian Head Acres, Winthrop Park, Cascades Park, Midtown, State Capital Complex, Kleman Plaza, Lake Ella, Tom Brown Park, South City, Leon County Civic Center, Apalachee Ridge Estates, Frenchtown and All Saints District. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING
